business.headline: How new Income Tax Bill 2025 brings relief for salaried and small taxpayersEndless forms and confusing jargon may soon be history. The New Income Tax Bill 2025 could be the game-changer salaried and small taxpayers have been waiting for.

The hidden catch in 40-year term insurance policies and how to choose betterBuying a 40-year term insurance policy is like paying rent for a house you'll never live in that long. It feels safe, but often it's money that could be better used elsewhere.

US Fed chair signals possible September rate cut, cites rising job market risksUS Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments open the door to a rate cut at the Fed's September 16-17 meeting, but also put heavy weight on jobs and inflation reports that will be received before then.

Planning Europe trip? Schengen visa hike may upset your trip budgetThe Schengen visa allows travellers to visit 29 European countries for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. Applicants must submit standard documents, including travel plans, insurance, and financial proof.

Sebi strikes at finfluencer Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading AcademyThe action followed complaints that penny stocks were being promoted during his training sessions, allegedly presented as classroom examples while encouraging students to invest.

Which bank offers higher 1-year FD? See rates from HDFC, ICICI, SBI and 3 othersMost lenders usually announce similar interest rates on one-year deposits, making it seem as if there isn't much of a difference in where you invest. However, a closer look at the latest rates reveals small but meaningful variations.

Sensex closes 694 points lower, Nifty below 25,000; Asian Paints down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 694 points lower at 81.306.85 points, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 213.65 points to end at 24,870.10.

This investor cut his Rs 10 lakh tax bill to 0. Here's howMany taxpayers assume that once the financial year ends, their chance to save tax is gone.and Ramesh was no exception. But instead of rushing, he used a little-known route that brought his tax bill down to nothing.

Dalal Street gears up for busy week with 5 market debuts, 2 IPOs in pipelineMangal Electrical Industries is set to debut on August 28 after finalising its allotment on August 25. Patel Retail, Vikram Solar, Gem Aromatics, and Shreeji Shipping Global will all list on August 26.

Wealthy Asian families bet big on crypto: ReportThe growing interest comes as Bitcoin recently hit an all-time high of over $124,000. New rules, such as Hong Kong's stablecoin legislation and the United States' GENIUS Act, have further boosted confidence in the sector.

Real-money gaming ban rocks advertising, sports sponsorships: What's at stake?The rise of money-based platforms created billions in advertising spend, now facing a sudden halt. This article examines how the ban on real-money gaming is reshaping India's advertising, sports sponsorships, and emerging e-sports opportunities.

Credit score confusion: Is CIBIL transparent enough in deciding your financial fate?The credit score by CIBIL can decide whether someone gets a car loan, a home loan, or even a credit card. Yet, very few actually know how CIBIL works or who controls it.

entertainment.headline:
Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 19 premiere: TV faces lose dominance in race for democracySalman Khan hosted the grand premiere of Bigg Boss 19 featuring sixteen diverse contestants and a unique democracy theme
 The episode was concise, engaging, and marked by Salman's energetic presence and fresh format

Gaurav Khanna reacts to highest-paid contestant tag on Bigg Boss 19Gaurav Khanna talks exclusively about his experience as a contestant on Bigg Boss 19. He addresses rumours about his pay and shares insights on friendships and competition in the house.

Meet women contestants from Salman's Bigg Boss 19 - Ashnoor, Nehal to Tanya, NagmaWith Salman Khan at the helm, the grand premiere of 'Bigg Boss 19' set the stage for a season packed with glamour, drama, and unexpected twists. From Ashnoor Kaur's sparkling entry to Natalia Janoszek's international charm, and from Tanya Mittal's bold questions to Nagma Mirajkar and Awez Darbar's couple entry, the mix of influencers, actors, models and entertainers promised high-voltage entertainment.

Tannishtha Chatterjee on cancer battle: It can't get worse than thisReflecting on her responsibilities, Tannishtha Chatterjee spoke about the difficulties of being a single mother while also caring for her own mother.

Who is Tanya Mittal, the Bigg Boss 19 contestant with 2.5 million Insta followers?'Bigg Boss 19' welcomes a fresh line-up of contestants, including Tanya Mittal, a social media influencer who first went viral during the Maha Kumbh and later gained attention for speaking out on the Pahalgam attack.

Tina Ahuja breaks silence on Govinda-Sunita divorce rumours, calls them baselessAmid speculation surrounding Govinda and Sunita Ahuja's marriage, their daughter Tina Ahuja has spoken out, dismissing the separation rumours as unfounded.

Shraddha Kapoor urges LinkedIn to fix her account flagged as fakeActor Shraddha Kapoor shared that she set up a LinkedIn account to document her journey as an entrepreneur, but hasn't been able to make use of it.

Bigg Boss 19 premiere: Ashnoor to Gaurav, Salman Khan welcomes 16 contestantsBigg Boss 19 Live: The wait is finally over as the much-anticipated season of Bigg Boss kicks off in just a few hours! With Salman Khan returning as host, fans can look forward to his signature wit, charm, and high-energy presence.

Mini Mathur slams paparazzi for zooming in on Kajol's body: How dare youActor Mini Mathur defended fellow actor Kajol after a video body-shaming the actor surfaced online. She slammed the paparazzo for zooming in on Kajol's body. In the comments, Mathur wrote that Kajol doesn't owe them eternal youth.

Karan Johar's 'nepo baby' Yash refuses to be launched. Priyanka, Kareena reactA recent video of filmmaker Karan Johar's son Yash in a 'nepo baby' T-shirt has stirred up social media. His son can be seen saying in the video that he does not want to be launched. Several celebrities, including Priyanka Chopra, Kareena Kapoor and Ananya Panday, amongst others, reacted to the video.

Manish Malhotra's Gustaakh Ishq with Vijay Varma and Fatima to release in NovemberFashion designer Manish Malhotra announced his first film as a producer on Sunday. Titled 'Gustaakh Ishq', the film stars Vijay Varma and Fatima Sana Shaikh in the lead roles. Slated for a November release this year, the first glimpse of the film will be out on Monday.

Suniel Shetty, Sanjay Dutt to spark nostalgia on Great Indian Kapil Show. PicsActors Suniel Shetty and Sanjay Dutt recently shot for an episode of 'The Great Indian Kapil Show.' The actors not only reminisced about the good old days but also gave an insight into their strong friendship.
Govinda's manager addresses divorce rumours: Everything is getting settledGovinda's manager and lawyer have addressed new rumours about the actor and Sunita Ahuja's divorce.

Kartik Aaryan checks off bucket list as he attends Coldplay's London concert. WatchKartik Aryan's London trip just turned special after he attended the Coldplay concert. The actor shared a video from the grand event at Wembley Stadium and expressed his joy.

Rajinikanth's team backtracks amid confusion over actor's meet and greet eventAfter Rajinikanth's team claimed that actor's Malaysia's meet and greet event as fake, they backtracked. This came after the organisers issued a statement.

Mughal-e-Azam: Epic clash celebrating India's composite cultureMughal-e-Azam remains an immortal cinematic masterpiece, blending epic father-son conflict, timeless romance, and iconic music with grand visuals that celebrate India's composite culture. Its powerful performances, unforgettable dialogues, and cultural resonance ensure its enduring legacy across generations.

KJo slams podcasters inviting guests who disrespect film industry: Needs to stopKaran Johar shared a note criticising podcasters who, he said, invite guests to speak negatively about the 'hardworking' members of the film fraternity.

Emily in Paris assistant director dies at 47 while filming in ItalyDiego Borella, the Assistant Director of 'Emily in Paris', died on August 22, while working on the fifth season of the series in Venice, Italy.

SRK's mother-in-law shows-off dance moves, fans praise her confidence. WatchActor Shah Rukh Khan's mother-in-law was captured dancing with her son in a viral video. Fans says, now they understand where Gauri gets her confidence from.

general news.headline: India will buy oil from wherever it gets best deal, says envoy to RussiaIndia has repeatedly defended its oil imports from Russia, arguing that access to affordable energy is crucial for its economic stability. Officials have also pointed out that other countries, including the US and European nations, continue some level of trade with Moscow.

UP dowry death: Mother-in-law arrested, victim's husband sent to 14-day custodyPolice in Greater Noida arrested Nikki Bhati's mother-in-law hours after her husband Vipin Bhati, accused of killing her over dowry, was shot while fleeing custody.

Trump's India tariffs 'aggressive leverage' to force Russia on Ukraine war: VanceJD Vance said President Donald Trump used "aggressive economic leverage," including secondary tariffs on India, to pressure Russia to end the Ukraine war. India defends its Russian oil imports as national interest as tensions rise in US-India trade ties.

Zelenskyy to visit India after PM invite, dates being finalised: Ukrainian envoyUkraine's Ambassador to India Oleksandr Polishch said Kyiv views India as a significant partner in peace negotiations because of its ties with Moscow and urged greater Indian involvement in ending the Russia-Ukraine war

Hanuman or Neil Armstrong? First space traveller answer exposes double rotBJP MP Anurag Thakur's interaction with students, where he suggested "Hanumanji was the first man in space", is problematic on multiple counts. The children said it was Neil Armstrong, and not Yuri Gagrin, who travelled to space first. The double rot is that the students were unaware of a basic fact while a parliamentarian was presenting mythology as history on National Space Day.

Man kills pregnant wife, dumps body parts in river, keeps headless torso at homeThe incident occurred due to frequent quarrels over family disputes between the 21-year-old victim, who was five-month-old pregnant, and the 27-year-old husband, who has been taken into police custody.

Djokovic overcomes pain to reach US Open 2nd round: Wish I was youngerNovak Djokovic said he wished he was younger after delivering a masterclass in Grand Slam tenacity to American teenager Learner Tien, battling past him 6-1, 7-6(3), 6-2 in the US Open first round on Sunday to launch his latest quest for a record 25th major title.

How the Supreme Court revised its stray dog judgmentIn an interim order, a three-judge bench directed only "aggressive dogs" to be held back from the streets, while coming down hard on the street-feeding of dogs.

Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 19 premiere: TV faces lose dominance in race for democracySalman Khan hosted the grand premiere of Bigg Boss 19 featuring sixteen diverse contestants and a unique democracy theme
 The episode was concise, engaging, and marked by Salman's energetic presence and fresh format

First human case of flesh-eating screwworm parasite detected in US: ReportScrewworms can be devastating in cattle and wildlife, and rarely infest humans, though an infestation in either an animal or a person can be fatal.

After 13 years, Pak Foreign Minister in Dhaka as Yunus presses for Saarc revivalDuring his meeting with Pakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar on Sunday, Yunus once again stressed the need to strengthen not only bilateral ties but also regional cooperation with Islamabad. At the heart of his push for stronger regional engagement is Yunus's renewed drive to get Saarc up and running.

Indian restaurant in London set on fire in arson attack, 5 diners injuredA teenager and a man were arrested after a fire tore through an east London Indian restaurant, injuring five. CCTV suggests arson, with two victims still in life-threatening condition.

Pujara: Test cricket's classical violinist in the era of heavy metal bandCheteshwar Pujara retired after a career defined by grit, discipline and resilience. He was a classical violinist in an age of metal and rap. When Pujara batted, the world seemed to pause. His stillness became ours.

Caught on camera: YouTuber swept away while filming reels at waterfall in OdishaSagar Tudu, a YouTuber, was filming videos for his channel at Dduma Waterfall in Koraput when he was swept away by a strong current.

US Open: Emma Raducanu ends Flushing Meadows jinx, secures first win since 2021Former US Open champion Emma Raducanu ended her Flushing Meadows drought with a 6-1, 6-2 win over Ena Shibahara in the first round. The 22-year-old Briton clinched her first US Open victory since her 2021 title run.

Dhaka rejects Pak Minister's claim that '1971 war issues' were resolved twiceThe foreign adviser said during the talks Dhaka sought the settlement of pre-independence financial issues, repatriation of stranded Pakistanis and "seek them to express regret, the apology for the genocide that took place here (in Bangladesh in 1971)."

US Open: Sinner has his own battle, not just Alcaraz threat in title defenceDefending US Open champion Jannik Sinner faces a two-front battle in New York — fitness concerns and the relentless Carlos Alcaraz. With their rivalry heating up, Sinner's title defence could hinge on his recovery as much as his tennis.

New BJP chief to be finalised? Key 3-day RSS meet in Jodhpur next monthThe high-profile meeting will be attended by RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale, the Sah Sarkaryavahs (joint general secretaries) and all members of the RSS National Executive committee, including the coordinators.

Jobless overnight, but families to feed: The human cost of India's gaming banThe ban on real-money online gaming is upending real lives. Thousands of professionals are desperately looking for jobs as their companies hit the dead end. The sector also sustained people earning from games of skills, like millions in India do from the stock market. This is the untold story of how the government's blanket ban on real money gaming platforms has hit lakhs of people.
Why the Kishtwar tragedy is a wake-up callThe recent flash flood in J&K is an urgent reminder of the need to address the impacts of climate change on fragile ecosystems in the mountains.

Video: Man kisses Rahul Gandhi on bike during Bihar rally; gets slapped by guardThe incident took place as the Lok Sabha Opposition leader, along with RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, was leading a motorcycle rally as part of the yatra.

Rain lashes parts of Delhi-NCR, causes waterlogging; more showers in storeThe India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for the city, with light showers expected to persist throughout the day.

Can sit with Amit Shah...: Ex-Karnataka minister jabs DK Shivakumar over RSS anthemSpeaking to the media, sacked Karnataka Minister K N Rajanna accused D KShivakumar of ideological inconsistency and questioned his political allegiance.

Was thinking about retirement for just a week: Cheteshwar Pujara breaks silenceCheteshwar Pujara broke his silence on his decision to retire from all formats of the game. Pujara decided to call time on his career on Sunday, August 24 after playing 103 Tests.

Tannishtha Chatterjee on cancer battle: It can't get worse than thisReflecting on her responsibilities, Tannishtha Chatterjee spoke about the difficulties of being a single mother while also caring for her own mother.

Tina Ahuja breaks silence on Govinda-Sunita divorce rumours, calls them baselessAmid speculation surrounding Govinda and Sunita Ahuja's marriage, their daughter Tina Ahuja has spoken out, dismissing the separation rumours as unfounded.

Shraddha Kapoor urges LinkedIn to fix her account flagged as fakeActor Shraddha Kapoor shared that she set up a LinkedIn account to document her journey as an entrepreneur, but hasn't been able to make use of it.

She slammed the paparazzo for zooming in on Kajol's body. In the comments, Mathur wrote that Kajol doesn't owe them eternal youth.

sports.headline: Amorim blames Manchester United's defensive mindset for draw vs FulhamManchester United manager Ruben Amorim lamented that his players abandoned their attacking principles after taking the lead against Fulham, arguing that a defensive mentality proved costly in Sunday's 1-1 Premier League draw at Craven Cottage.

Djokovic overcomes pain to reach US Open 2nd round: Wish I was youngerNovak Djokovic said he wished he was younger after delivering a masterclass in Grand Slam tenacity to American teenager Learner Tien, battling past him 6-1, 7-6(3), 6-2 in the US Open first round on Sunday to launch his latest quest for a record 25th major title.

Carlos Alcaraz eyes New York glory to end three-year agonising waitCarlos Alcaraz, already a five-time Grand Slam champion, is still chasing consistency on hard courts, with his 2022 US Open triumph remaining his lone major success on the surface. Armed with momentum from a strong 2025 season, he now returns to New York determined to end his drought and reclaim hard-court glory.

Pujara: Test cricket's classical violinist in the era of heavy metal bandCheteshwar Pujara retired after a career defined by grit, discipline and resilience. He was a classical violinist in an age of metal and rap. When Pujara batted, the world seemed to pause. His stillness became ours.

US Open: Sinner has his own battle, not just Alcaraz threat in title defenceDefending US Open champion Jannik Sinner faces a two-front battle in New York — fitness concerns and the relentless Carlos Alcaraz. With their rivalry heating up, Sinner's title defence could hinge on his recovery as much as his tennis.

US Open: Emma Raducanu ends Flushing Meadows jinx, secures first win since 2021Former US Open champion Emma Raducanu ended her Flushing Meadows drought with a 6-1, 6-2 win over Ena Shibahara in the first round. The 22-year-old Briton clinched her first US Open victory since her 2021 title run.

Rohit Yadav keeps World Championship hopes alive, Sreeshankar misses qualifying markRohit Yadav clinched gold in men's javelin with an 83.65m throw at the National Inter-State Athletics Championships, while Murali Sreeshankar fell short of World Championships qualifying mark despite winning long jump title.

United's wait for first win drags on after frustrating Fulham drawManchester United missed out on managing their first win of the Premier League season after playing out a frustrating 1-1 draw against Fulham, which has left manager Ruben Amorim with some gruelling questions to answer.

Carlos Alcaraz can reclaim No.1 ranking from Jannik Sinner. Here's howCarlos Alcaraz has a strong chance to reclaim the ATP No.1 ranking after the US Open 2025, with a title or deep run enough to overtake Jannik Sinner. Alcaraz had held the top spot in the rankings back in 2022 as a 19-year-old.

From underdogs to giants: NorthEast United's stunning rise with Durand Cup doubleNorthEast United FC's 6-1 Durand Cup final demolition of Diamond Harbour marked a historic back-to-back triumph, cementing their rise from underdogs to Indian football heavyweights with swagger, collective brilliance, and a vision for long-term dominance.

Rohit Yadav keeps World Championship hopes alive, Sreeshankar misses qualifying markRohit Yadav clinched gold in men's javelin with an 83.65m throw at the National Inter-State Athletics Championships, while Murali Sreeshankar fell short of World Championships qualifying mark despite winning long jump title.

United's wait for first win drags on after frustrating Fulham drawManchester United missed out on managing their first win of the Premier League season after playing out a frustrating 1-1 draw against Fulham, which has left manager Ruben Amorim with some gruelling questions to answer.

Carlos Alcaraz can reclaim No.1 ranking from Jannik Sinner. Here's howCarlos Alcaraz has a strong chance to reclaim the ATP No.1 ranking after the US Open 2025, with a title or deep run enough to overtake Jannik Sinner. Alcaraz had held the top spot in the rankings back in 2022 as a 19-year-old.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
